bug.author: harpone
bug.summary: Using `terminate_on_nan=True` on TPU leads to huge slowdowns
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Using trainer = Trainer(terminate_on_nan=True, ...) leads to calling TrainerTrainingTricksMixin().detect_nan_tensors(), which is very slow on TPU. About 5x slower forward passes for resnet50 scale nets. Should maybe raise a warning if using TPUs and terminate_on_nan.

comments.comment: yes terminate on nan always leads to a slow down, also for GPU and CPU not just TPU. I don't see a way to speed it up, and it's not clear to me why it is a bug? It should only be used for debugging.
Seemed pretty fast on GPU, but OK. No need to speed it up but a warning would be nice.
